maxaifeaturization.timeseries.univariate.autocorrelation(spark_df, groupby_col, datetime_col, value_col, nlags, partial=False)[source]

computes the Pearson correlation between the Series and its shifted self

Args:

spark_df (spark DataFrame): the dataframe on which operation is to be performed groupby_col (str): entity column name for which a time series is defined datetime_col (str): datetime column name value_col (str): value/quantity column name nlags (int): number of lags for which the autocorrelation is to be calculated partial (bool): if True, partial correlation will be calculated

Raises:

ValueError

Returns:

spark DataFrame: a dataframe with lag and autocorrelation for each grouped entity

import pandas as pd

entities = [“A1”, “B2”, “C3”, “D4”, “E5”] data_list = [] date_list = [] entity_list = [] for entity in entities:

for i in range(0, 100):

sin_val = np.sin(i) + np.random.rand() date_val = datetime(2022, 1, 1) + timedelta(days=i) entity_list.append(entity) data_list.append(sin_val) date_list.append(date_val)

pandas_df = pd.DataFrame({

“machine_id”: entity_list, “date”: date_list, “sensor_reading”: data_list

}) spark_df = spark.createDataFrame(pandas_df)

abdf = autocorrelation(spark_df, groupby_col=”machine_id”, datetime_col=”date”, value_col=”sensor_reading”, nlags=2, partial=True) ```

maxaifeaturization.timeseries.univariate.check_stationarity(spark_df, groupby_col, datetime_col, value_col, test='adf', **kwargs)[source]

Example ` ddf = time_series_decomposition(spark_df, groupby_col="machine_id", datetime_col="date", value_col="sensor_reading", method="loess") `
